definition: the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
contrary/opposite/backwards/to go against/to oppose/to betray/to rebel

sentences.english: After all Jonah had done, God still wanted to use him.
sentences.chinese: 不管约拿曾经如何背逆，但神仍然愿意使用他。

sentences.english: It was because they disobeyed God's laws and because of their outright idolatry.
sentences.chinese: 因为他们背逆神的律法，和公然拜其他偶像。

sentences.english: The people had rebelled against God, who had been faithful and gracious to them.
sentences.chinese: 神信实恩慈地待以色列人，他们却背逆了祂。

sentences.english: Salvation is a gift from God, the very Person whom we have disobeyed and wronged.
sentences.chinese: 救恩是神的恩赐，我们却曾背逆得罪他。

sentences.english: Come to know the consequences of rebellion will bring severe judgment from God.
sentences.chinese: 认识顽梗背逆的结果，必定招徕神严厉的审判。

sentences.english: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.
sentences.chinese: 我们犯罪背逆，你并不赦免。

definition: to break an agreement/to go back on one's word/to fail to keep one's promise
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
